review: Where to begin. First things first, I have also purchased the Fire TV box, and love that as well. Since this is much more inexpensive, it makes a great man cave or bedroom streaming device. I decided to try it out in the master bedroom to watch a little tv with the family before bed, and it does not dissapoint. It immediately starts playing once prompted, which is great. Not only does the playback start instantly, the picture quality is top notch.  The content inside is unbelievable, if you have an Amazon Prime membership and a Netflix account, you have so many options to chose from in just those two apps. The remote that comes with this Fire Stick is identical to the box set, except for the voice search, which is not missed.  I have had it in use for two weeks now, and I would definitely consider purchasing more to go along with other TVs in my house.Rating 1 to 5 (5 being 5 stars)Price-- 5Ease of setup--5Ease of navigation--5Remote-- 5Content--5Picture quality--5

review: The Amazon Fire TV Stick has turned my 55' Samsung TV into a smart tv. The hardest thing about installing it was getting at the HDMI port on the TV because it is on a flush mount. Once I got it into a port and hooked up the power set up was very simple. I live in the sticks and have a slow 3mbps DSL connection. It found my WIFI signal with no problem. I have played with it a little bit. Netflix loads with no problems and plays flawlessly. I've also tried Pandora with the same results. I am VERY SATISFIED with this purchase. I have already recommended it to friends. I'm glad I opted for this over the other similar products that are available.
